data.event: The population was 5,471 at the 2000 census, while the 2010 census lists Montgomery's population at 18,438.

event.title: came to the Chicago area from Logan County, Ohio in November 1832

data.event: The first European settler arriving in the area was Jacob Carpenter, who came to the Chicago area from Logan County, Ohio in November 1832.

event.title: fall of 1835, Daniel S. Gray, from Montgomery County, New York, visited

data.event: In the fall of 1835, Daniel S. Gray, from Montgomery County, New York, visited the area where his brother Nicholas Gray had located in the previous spring, on a farm now within the limits of Kendall County.

event.title: had located in the previous spring, on a farm now

data.event: In the fall of 1835, Daniel S. Gray, from Montgomery County, New York, visited the area where his brother Nicholas Gray had located in the previous spring, on a farm now within the limits of Kendall County.

event.title: fall of 1836, after his family moved

data.event: He made immediate preparations to settle there, and in the fall of 1836, after his family moved from New York state, he built the first wooden house in the area.

event.title: was located in the southern part of what is now

data.event: It was located in the southern part of what is now Montgomery, near the west bank of the Fox River.
